Award.AbstractNarration:
This Small Business Innovation Research Phase I project will allow the development of a new optoelectronic component, to allow improved installation, maintenance and critical network monitoring. This new optical component is a key building block in providing platform technology for new fiber optic sensors and instrumentation at a dramatically lower cost. This novel technology will open new markets not addressed by current instruments typically having much lower resolution, and higher costs. Specifically, the new optoelectronic component will be designed to produce new optical instruments that are both low-cost, and high-resolution. In this development effort, a demonstration of the new optical component will be built and optimized and characterized for several telecommunications markets, such as installation and maintenance of fiber to home, real-time monitoring of networks within data centers and other critical infrastructure for our nation.

The broader impact/commercial potential of this project provides for new optical communications testing equipment to enable maintenance of critical optical networks promptly and inexpensively. This project will help to cost-effectively ensure the availability, reliability and security of the optical networks on which our nation increasingly depends. Specific commercial opportunities include: energy generation and distribution, aerospace and other mobile platforms, high speed computing high speed optical fiber data transmission to support teraflop/s and higher computing speed, and hand held and integrated fiber optic (FO) telecommunications health monitoring systems. This technology supports the installation, testing, and operations of optical systems for these markets. For the energy market, applications include low-cost high-resolution sensing and communication systems for down-hole and processing facilities as well as wind turbines sensing and communication of fiber optic networks on airplanes, ships, and other mobile platforms providing for safer, more efficient transportation systems of the future. In telecommunications, FO systems are gaining market acceptance and are being installed in neighborhoods, office buildings, fiber-to-the-home, local area networks, and wide area networks. This optoelectronic component will be the building block for new optical interrogation instruments providing customers with a FO testing solution option at an affordable price.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Low-cost Reflectometer (Award: 1315212) Project Outcomes Report

 

There is a clearly identified need for a fiber optic test instrument capable of finding faults and detecting unauthorized access to fiber optic lines with greater resolution and at a much lower cost than is currently commercially available.  To address that need, we are developing a new reflectometer technology to provide inexpensive optical measurements with a resolution of <1 cm, a range of over a kilometer, and which will cost much less than currently used technology. During the Phase I program we completed all the planned objectives and have clearly identified the additional development required to build the reflectometer module. We plan to continue the development of the device as described in the Phase I but should be able to measure the coherence function to a greater distance beyond the proposed kilometre length.  Results from the Phase I demonstrated that this can be accomplished and provided the insight on building modules with longer coherence lengths.  After incorporating precision laser tuning that was designed and built during the Phase I we will be able to characterize and optimize closed loop laser coherence further than we have before and lastly will incorporate precision electronic frequency tuning.  To accomplish these requirements in a cost-effective manner, commercially available off the shelf laser diodes will be used and the wavelength sweep will be precisely controlled while keeping the phase locked through our unique feedback and control system.  The end use of our instrument includes measuring and monitoring the installation of fiber optics and the use and maintenance of large-scale fiber optic deployments for communications. Specifically for deployments involving avionics and shipboard communications, military applications, fiber to the premise/home, and energy markets. As a direct result of these diverse market requirements, the project is focused on a platform reflectometer design that offers our customers either a complete or customizable solution.  Ultimately, this strategy will allow manufacturing of our proprietary new electro-optic components on a very large scale while driving costs well below any product that is currently commercially available. The need for a product with our specifications of detecting and locating centimeter-scale flaws or intrusions in an optical fiber over lengths up to a kilometer were verified through many meetings with end-users. During the Phase I, extensive market research was conducted through a network of contacts derived from the decades of experience possessed by the key personnel. As a result, several potential manufacturing partnerships were developed, multiple sales, marketing and distribution channel partners have been identified, were able to generate a high interest from end users, and successfully established relationships with several investors and potential investors.
